access.notes: Static HTML served via S3/CloudFront. Main page is the EHI export overview; one click to 'Data Tables' viewer with full data dictionary. curl works perfectly, no special headers beyond User-Agent.

export_format.description: Export produces a folder structure with three main directories: Documents (clinical documents as ZIP files containing RTF/PDF/DOC), Images (TIF/video with XML annotation files), and Tables (CSV files, one per database table). Patient Population export also includes TAR-archived images (5GB limit per tar) and a Bulk Export Status CSV. Documents are organized into GenFileBlob, TMSCatalogBlob, and PracPersonSecureMsgBlob subfolders with 10,000 document limit per folder.

documentation.notes: Each table page includes field name, datatype (INTEGER, CHARACTER(n), DECIMAL(n,n), DATE, etc.), default value, null option (MANDATORY/OPTIONAL), description/comment, parent table relationships with join conditions, and child table relationships with cascade/restrict behavior.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical tables: EncounterFinding, EncounterDiagnosis, EncounterVital, PatientProblem, Allergy, PatientRx (66 fields), PatientRxFill, Diagnosis, ClinicalCustomFinding, AdvanceDirective, CareTeamMember, PatientCarePlan, PatientCPGoal, MedcinFinding, Vaccine, VaccineReaction, OB tables (OBPregnancy, OBBirth, etc.), Questionnaire

secure_messages.evidence: PracPersonSecureMessage (21 fields - stores secure messages received for a person), PracPersonSecureMsgBlob (stores message data/content), PatientPortalAccess (portal access status). Population export explicitly creates a PracPersonSecureMsgBlob folder for message documents.

billing_financial.evidence: Comprehensive billing: Charge (45 fields), ChargeActivity, ChargeAuxData, ChargeCoverage, ChargeNote, Claim (16 fields), ClaimCharge, ClaimNote, Payment (29 fields), PaymentAssignment, PaymentReversal, PaymentVoid, CopayActivity, Adjustment, Account, AccountBill, AccountBillItem, AccountStatement, AccountStatementItem, ResponsibilityTransfer, plus full PlanClaim family (PlanClaim, PlanClaimCharge, PlanClaimChargeRemit, PlanClaimChargeRemitAdj, PlanClaimRemit, etc. - 12+ tables)

insurance_coverage.evidence: PolicyMember (insurance policies a patient is covered by), Carrier (insurance carrier definitions), Plan, PlanGroup, PlanAltID, ChargeCoverage (insurance coverage order for charges), LabOrderInsCoverage, Eligibility (X12 eligibility data), EligibilityBenefit, EligibilityComment, PHIAuthorization, PriorAuthInfo, PriorAuthInfoResponse, RxEligibility tables (RxEligRequest, RxEligPBM, RxEligPBMResponse, etc.)

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Appointment table, ApptQuestionnaire, ApptRecall, ApptRoom, ApptStaff, Encounter (61 fields), EncounterEvent, plus specialty visit tables: InpatientVisit, OBEncounter, OBPrenatalVisit, OBPostpartumVisit, RISVisit

documents_images.evidence: Document, DocumentAttributeValue, DocumentInterpretation, DocumentNote, GenFile (general file definitions), GenFileBlob (file data), TMSCatalog (clinical document catalog), TMSCatalogBlob (document content), TMSActivity. Export includes dedicated Documents and Images folders with actual file content (JPEG, TIF, video clips, ZIP-wrapped RTF/PDF/DOC). Annotations exported as XML .ann files.

audit_trails.evidence: No dedicated audit/access log tables found. Searched for audit, access_log, login - none present. History tables exist (AddressHistory, PersonHistory, PatientProblemHistory, etc.) which track changes to specific records, but no system-wide audit trail of who accessed what records.

additional_coverage.referrals: Referral, ReferralActivity, ReferralDiagnosis, ReferralNote, ReferralTreatmentPlan, ReferralTreatmentResult, RefDoctor, RefDocRole
additional_coverage.lab_orders: Lab, LabOrder (+ 14 related tables: LabOrderActivity, LabOrderTest, LabOrderTestResult, LabOrderTestResultNote, LabSpecimenType, etc.)
additional_coverage.medications: PatientRx (66 fields), PatientRxActivity, PatientRxFill, PatientRxFillAttribute, PatientRxDenial, RxRequest, RxChangeRequest, RxNote, PersonDrugIneffective, DURAlert
additional_coverage.obstetrics: OBPatient, OBPregnancy, OBBirth, OBBirthRace, OBUltraSound, OBEncounter, OBInitialVisit, OBPrenatalVisit, OBPostpartumVisit
additional_coverage.demographics: Person, PersonName, PersonRace, PersonTribalAffiliation, PersonRelationship, PersonOccupation, PersonAltID, PersonContactMethod, Address, Phone, Email, Patient, PracPerson

downloaded_files.description: 261 individual table .htm files plus DBTOC.htm, index.html, and include/ directory with JS/CSS
downloaded_files.curl_command: for table in $(cat table_names.txt); do curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0' -o "downloads/data-tables/$table.htm" "https://ehi.greenwayhealth.com/Intergy/EHI/Viewer/Contracts/$table.htm"; done

issues: No downloadable ZIP/PDF bundle available â€” documentation is only available as the HTML site (261 individual pages)
No audit trail tables included in the export
No sample/example export files or test data provided
No developer guide for processing exports beyond the export structure description on the main page
summary: Greenway Health provides excellent EHI export documentation for Intergy via a dedicated subdomain (ehi.greenwayhealth.com). The documentation covers 261 database tables with full field-level detail including datatypes, nullability, descriptions, and parent/child table relationships. The export itself produces CSV files for all tabular data plus actual document and image files (ZIP-wrapped clinical docs, TIF/video images with XML annotations). Coverage is comprehensive: clinical data, billing/claims (45+ field Charge table, full claim lifecycle), insurance (PolicyMember, Eligibility, Carrier), secure messages (with blob content), appointments, documents/images, referrals, labs, medications, OB, and more. The only notable gap is the absence of audit trail tables.
